definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Passersby, one by one, threw paper money and coins into the small bucket beside his feet.
sentences.chinese: 过路人纷纷向他脚下的一个小铁桶里扔着纸币和硬币。

sentences.english: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
sentences.chinese: 她探出车窗口，向一个过路人打招呼。

sentences.english: Some try to hand me money they don't understand.
sentences.chinese: 有过路人想扔钱给我，他们并不知道。

sentences.english: She always watches the passers-by with a pair of binoculars.
sentences.chinese: 她总是用望远镜观察过路人。

sentences.english: A passerby 2 believed him and bought it for twenty pieces of gold.
sentences.chinese: 一个过路人相信了他的话，拿出二十金把它买了下来。

sentences.english: The old man asked a passer-by to tell him the way to the Great Wall Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人请一位过路人告诉他去长城饭店的路。

sentences.english: That day, there was a rarity on the boulevard, a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 这天，路上恰巧有个难逢难遇的过路人。

sentences.english: The police searched everyone for anything banned.
sentences.chinese: 警察在每个过路人身上搜寻禁带品。

sentences.english: At least three passers-by witnessed the accident.
sentences.chinese: 至少有三名过路人目击了那次事故。

sentences.english: Her screams drew passers-by to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 她的惊叫声把过路人吸引到了现场。

sentences.english: This is temple… Passer looks, just know without what amazing thing.
sentences.chinese: 过路人一看，才知没有什么了不起的事。

sentences.english: A passerby believed him and bought it for twenty pieces of gold.
sentences.chinese: 一个过路人相信了他的话，拿出二十金把它买了下来。

sentences.english: Beggars almost sell themselves as himan being to arouse the pity of passers-by.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐出卖的几乎是他本人，经引起过路人的怜悯。

sentences.english: Wei Hua asked a passer-by to take a photo of her standing on the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 魏华请一位过路人给她照了一张站在桥上的照片。

sentences.english: His head seemed to go round, and he clutched at the nearest passerby.
sentences.chinese: 他感到头有些晕，便抓住离他最近的过路人。

sentences.english: The bomb blast killed several harmless passers-by.
sentences.chinese: 那颗炸弹炸死了几个无辜的过路人。

definition: pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
to stand in a circle and watch
